AX0019/24 AIC RESTRICTIONS LFBD/BORDEAUX/MERIGNAC VALIDITY:24OCT24-UFN 1. MONITORING OF ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATION INFRINGEMENTS AIRCRAFT MUST COMPLY WITH THE PROCEDURES WHICH AIM TO REDUCE NOISE POLLUTION, DEFINED IN THE MINISTERIAL ORDER OF MARCH 6, 2009 INTRODUCING NOISE ABATEMENT PROCEDURES AT BORDEAUX-MRIGNAC AERODROME. IN CASE OF NON-COMPLIANCE, THE AUTORITE DE CONTROLE DES NUISANCES AEROPORTUAIRES (ACNUSA) CAN SANCTION ENVIRONMENTAL INFRINGEMENTS WITH FINES OF UP TO 20 000 EUR. 2. CASE OF LFBD SID RNAV 29 DEPARTURES TOWARDS THE SOUTH FOR INSTRUMENT DEPARTURES TOWARDS THE SOUTH FROM RUNWAY 29 OF BORDEAUX-MERIGNAC, THE OBLOC 6R AND VAVIX 6R PROCEDURES PROVIDE THE MEANS TO AVOID FLYING OVER URBANIZED AREAS OF THE TOWN OF SAINT-JEAN-D LLLAC. IN ORDER TO DO THIS, THESE RNAV PROCEDURES INTEGRATE A SERIES OF INSTRUCTIONS TO BE RESPECTED IN THE FOLLOWING SEQUENCE : 1/ ONCE THE AIRCRAFT ALIGNED AT THE THRESHOLD OF RUNWAY 29, AFTER POWERING UP, TAKE-OFF ON RUNWAY HEADING 286 WITH THE OBLIGATION TO FLY OVER THE DEPARTURE END OF RUNWAY (DER) 2/ ONCE THE DEPARTURE END OF RUNWAY HAS BEEN FLOWN OVER, MAKE A HEADING ALTERATION OF 10 TO THE LEFT WHILE CONTINUING TO CLIMB (CAPTURE HEADING 276) 3/ DURING THE CLIMB TO HEADING 276, CAPTURE PUBLISHED TURN ALTITUDE AT 500 FT ASFC (TURN AT A PRESCRIBED TURNING ALTITUDE OF 500 FT GROUND WHOSE RNAV CODING IS AT OR ABOVE 500 FT) 4/ ONCE THE TNA ALTITUDE OF 500 FT ASFC IS REACHED, MAKE A LEFT TURN TO REACH BD929 POINT USING THE DIRECT TO FIX PATH MODE (PATH TERMINATOR DF). IT TURNS OUT THAT, FOR SOME FORMS OF FMS ON-BOARD AUTOMATION, WHEN NAV MODE IS ENGAGED, THE ACCUMULATION AND SEQUENCE OF THE DIFFERENT COMPONENTS OF THE CODED RNAV TRAJECTORY APPEAR POTENTIALLY PROBLEMATIC THE 500 FT ASFC TURN MAY NOT BE TRIGGERED AFTER THE DER, WHICH CAN THEN CAUSE ENVIRONMENTAL INFRINGEMENTS. THE SERVICE DE NAVIGATION ARIENNE SUD-OUEST (SNA-SO) HAS LAUNCHED WORK TO MODIFY THE OBLOC 6R AND VAVIX 6R PROCEDURES BY MODIFYING THE ELEMENTS OF RNAV CODING TO OPTIMIZE ITS USE IN NAV MODE. 3. ACTION TO BE TAKEN AIRLINE OPERATORS ARE REQUESTED TO PAY CLOSE ATTENTION TO THE COMPLIANCE WITH THE TRAJECTORY AND TO ADAPT THEIR CREW PROCEDURES IF NECESSARY IN ORDER TO AVOID ANY ENVIRONMENTAL INFRINGEMENTS.

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

FOR OVERFLIGHTS OR ARRIVALS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED BY THE PILOT, WITH SUFFICIENT NOTICE (BETWEEN 10 AND 25 MINUTES BEFORE ENTERING THE CRNA), TO ENSURE THAT THE CONNECTION IS ESTABLISHED, AND WITH THE FIRST FRENCH ACC CROSSED. IF LOGON HAS ALREADY BEEN ESTABLISHED WITH AN ADJACENT UPSTREAM ACC PROVIDING LOGON FORWARD, OR IF FORWARD HAS FAILED, ADVANCE NOTICE IS NOT REQUIRED. FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. IF LOGON IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A TECHNICAL REASON KNOWN OR UNKNOWN TO THE E PILOT, THE CREW WILL ANNOUNCE 'UNABLE CPDLC'. REFERENCE AIP FRANCE GEN 3.4-9.

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
